column4: I am trying to mount a .bin file to a cdrom.... so I made the dir /media/[mountdir] .... and typed "mount -o loop vfat [.bin location] /media/[mountdir] .... but it says :  wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/loop1 ... any suggestions? (soz for repost)
hmm.. yea.. didn't tell me much either
I'm wondering whether the file is even mountable.  what makes you think it i?
I used to mount it in windows.. it's a cd image
sudo mount -o loop -t iso9660 file.bin /media/iso then?
I want to unmount a drive, because I thought it would REPLACE a mount, not ADD... and I mounted a drive on a place where there allready was a mount.. now I cant unmount them...
the last mount will overshadow the first.  the 1st will still be mounted, but you won't see it until you umount the 2nd
try umount with the device, or with the mount point (whichever you didn't try)
mount on its own will list what's mounted, and where
you need to not be "cd"ed to it in any terminal, and not have any files open on it
close any file browsers or terminals that are using /media/reason
